page.title: 02GOSPORT IN THE PAST
page.content: Memories of a{'Gosportian'} How has our area changed since the Second World War? _ We asked a frequent visitor to our school, Mrs. Kath. Habens who has lived here all her life, serving as a WREN in Portsmouth during the war. She told us that the old part of Gosport shows most signs of change resulting from bomb damage and re_development. All that remains of Gosport's railway station are the platforms and station building, both in a derelict state. She remembers the rows of small houses, St. Matthew's Church and the School by St. George Barracks, now a car park and boat building area. The ferry area too, has changed. She used to catch a small ferryboat across to Portsmouth and there was a 'floating bridge' drawn by chains.
